scripting

Class geom

  • java.lang.Object
    • scripting.geom

  • public class geom
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions to manage gvSIG geometries

    • Method Detail

      • createGeometry

        public static Geometry createGeometry(int type,
                                      int subtype)
        Returns a new geometry with a concrete type and subtype or None if can't create geometry.
        Parameters:
        type: - geometry type
        subtype, - optional: geometry subtype
        Returns:
        geometry

      • createPoint2D

        public static Geometry createPoint2D(double x,
                                     double y,
                                     int subtype)
        Create a Point2D. If values of x and y are None, it will create an empty Point2D geometry
        Parameters:
        vertexes, - optional: vertexes of a new line
        Returns:
        line geometry

      • createLine2D

        public static Geometry createLine2D(java.lang.Object vertexes)
        Create a Line2D. If vertexes value is None it will create an empty Line2D geometry.
        Parameters:
        vertexes, - optional: vertexes of a new line
        Returns:
        line geometry

      • createPolygon2D

        public static Geometry createPolygon2D(java.lang.Object vertexes)
        Create a Polygon2D. If vertexes value is None it will create an empty Polygon2D.
        Parameters:
        vertexes, - optional: vertexes of a new line
        Returns:
        line geometry

      • createPoint

        public static Geometry createPoint(int subtype,
                                   double... coords)
        Returns a new point with a subtype and sets the value for the X, Y, Z and M coordinates (default 0,0,0,0) or None if can't create point or none coordinates are established. If you pass a point geometry as a parameter, it will return the same geometry point. Examples: createPoint(D2, 1, 2) -> Point2D(1, 2) createPoint(D2, [1, 2]) -> Point2D(1, 2) createPoint(D3, 1, 2, 3) -> Point3D(1,2,3) createPoint(D2M, 1, 2, 4) -> Point (1, 2, 4) createPoint(D3M, 1, 2, 3, 4) -> Point (1, 2, 3, 4) createPoint(D2, Point2D(1, 2) -> Point2D(1, 2)
        Parameters:
        subtype, - geometry subtype
        coords, - list of coordinates or points
        Returns:

      • createMultiPoint

        public static Geometry createMultiPoint(int subtype,
                                        java.lang.Object points)
        Returns a new multipoint with a subtype from a list of Points instancesor list of coordinates. If points are None, returns an empty multipoint geometry. If it can't create the geometry, return None.
        Parameters:
        subtype, - geometry subtype
        points, - list of coordinates or points
        Returns:

      • createPolygon

        public static Geometry createPolygon(int subtype,
                                     java.lang.Object vertexes)
        Returns a new polygon with a subtype from a list of Points instances or list of tuples/lists like [[x1, y1], [x2, y2], ...., [xn, yn]] are allowed. If points are None, returns an empty polygon geometry. If it can't create the geometry, return None. Example: createPolygon( D2, [point1, point2, [10, 10], point1])
        Parameters:
        subtype, - geometry subtype
        vertexes, - list of coordinates or points
        Returns:

      • createMultiPolygon

        public static Geometry createMultiPolygon(int subtype,
                                          java.lang.Object polygons)
        Returns a new multipolygon with a subtype from a list of Polygon instances or list of coordinates. If polygons are None, returns an empty multipolygon geometry. If it can't create the geometry, return None. Example: createMultiPolygon( D2, [polygon1, [[0,0],[10,0],point1,[0,0]], polygon3])
        Parameters:
        subtype, - geometry subtype
        polygons, - list of polygons.
        Returns:

      • createLine

        public static Geometry createLine(int subtype,
                                  java.lang.Object vertexes)
        Returns a new line with a subtype from a list of Points instances or list of coordinates as tuples/lists like ([x1, y1], [x2, y2], ...., [xn, yn]) are allowed. If points are None, returns an empty line geometry. If it can't create the geometry, return None. Example: createLine( D2, [point0, [10,0], [10, 10], point0])
        Parameters:
        subtype, - geometry subtype
        vertexes, - list of coordinates or points
        Returns:

      • createMultiLine

        public static Geometry createMultiLine(int subtype,
                                       java.lang.Object lines)
        Returns a new multiline with a subtype from a list of Line instances or list of coordinates. If polygons are None, returns an empty multipolygon geometry. If it can't create the geometry, return None. Example: createMultiLine( D2, [line1, [[0,0],[10,0],point1], line3])
        Parameters:
        subtype, - geometry subtype
        lines, - list of lines.
        Returns:

      • createEnvelope

        public static Envelope createEnvelope(java.lang.Object pointMax,
                                      java.lang.Object pointMin,
                                      int dimension)
        Returns envelope as a minimum bounding box or rectangle. This envelope is equivalent to the GM_Envelope specified in ISO 19107. If points are None it will create an empty Envelope
        Parameters:
        pointMax, - optional, None by default
        pointMin, - optional, None by default
        dimension -
        Returns:

      • createGeometryFromWKT

        public static Geometry createGeometryFromWKT(java.lang.String WKT)
        Create geometry from WKT (Well Known Text)
        Parameters:
        WKT -
        Returns:
